Fallout: New Vegas is a role-playing video game in the Fallout series, currently in development by Obsidian Entertainment (many employees of which worked for Black Isle Studios on Fallout and Fallout 2) and has been scheduled for release on October 19, 2010, in North America, and October 22, 2010, in Europe.

Okay, to build on my previous comment, for those people experiencing the "Open Tray" problem, instead of opening and closing the tray 30-40 times waiting for the disc to be read, if you open up the tray, put the game in and then tilt your Xbox slowly so it's almost vertical so that the disc tray and power button is high up at an angle. Emphasis on the word SLOWLY! Then, while holding the Xbox at this angle, take one hand and push the tray in fast and firm and hold it there. This should load the game on the first or second try. Definitely beats opening and closing the tray 30 some-plus times. Hope this helps!

And for the thousandth time, it's NTSC AND PAL. It is a working torrent and the game is fucking fantastic as long as you liked Fallout 3. It's practically an epic Fallout 3 expansion but an excellent and fun-as-fuck one at that. I'll be seeding for quite some time so download away!

So to be clear, I have to open one of the RAR files and drag the .iso file to desktop then use image burn to write it to a CD?  Is the .iso all I need to write to disk? or do the other files before the RAR need to be wrote on the CD too?  Please answer

Choonb: Open one of the .RAR files and unpack it, then go to the folder where it was unpacked to and there should be a .dvd file in addition to the .iso file. Select the .dvd file and if you have burning software it should start up automatically for you. If you don't have burning software then I strongly recommend IMGBurn. It's free, easy to use and reliable.

the 'open tray' issue happened with me as well... tried & tested experienced pirate... and yet i have no explanation for this... 

like someone said in a previous comment... after opening the tray and close the try a little more then 30 times... it finally read the game... normally i would have burned it again after reading through the comments... but i saw a least 4 or more comments with similar issues and outcomes... so i thought I'd give it a try... and sure enough after a little more then 30 trys (estimate)... it worked... 

not sure if I'd have to go through this again after taking the game out or turning my xbox back on (playing right now, don't wanna risk it yet)... but I'll give an update...

If this happens to you (it read 'open tray')... you can try this... or i would recommend trying another version (torrent)... waiting for a newer version (torrent)... JUST! BUY THE DAMN GAME!... wait for the PC version (torrent)...

someone also recommend... after doing the 'open tray' trick... and if/when you get it to read/work... load it to your hard-drive...

have fun...

No problem, Choonb. And to clarify one last time on the 'Open Tray' error some people are getting with Fallout: New Vegas, forget opening and closing the tray 20-30 times or tilting the frigging system every which way to get the game to load. I figured out my problem was the disc I had burned the game on. If your other burned games work fine and you're only getting the 'Open Tray' error on the Fallout: NV disc, then you should either try to burn another copy and if this doesn't work, definitely just get a different brand of DVD+R DL discs -- I just bought some Memorex at Radio Shack and it's working like a charm! And this will be the last time I give advice on this subject, I promise! :P

I am having an "unable to read disc" issue. xbox sees the game, shows the Vegas icon in My Xbox and says gives me the option to play. i tried installing it and got to 38% i ran abgx360 latest version with proper config and everything was ok after 2 runs with level 2. i burned onto a Memorex +RDL  same ones ive used on about 6-8 other games ive burned since i got my drive flashed. this is the first issue ive had. i am going to redownload the game and recheck with abgx. and ill post an update. going by what the guy who flashed my xbox said and what *Gallynuke posted to *choonb.

After redownloading, using abgx360 again, and doing a burn on the same kind of Memorex disc i got it loaded just fine, installing it to the hard drive now. Good game, and works. if you have an issue redownload and burn onto either a Verbatim / Memorex ive been reading that sucessful burns are using those DVD's. As for people who dont know what they are doing. get a hold of someone who knows. (your xbox dvd drive needs new firmware... noticed a few ppl saying they were getting this game burnt as if it was a DVD movie)
